summary:
Always acting on the cutting edge of technology and humans. Fits best a position in which technology is used creatively to solve complex problems. Can place herself well in the position of the customer/end user and gives honest advice on the feasibility and cost vs. benefits of technical solutions.

Words that describe me: fast thinker, 'nothing is impossible', helicopter view, dedicated, curious, accurate, motivator, leader, no nonsense, creative, skilled communicator (oral and written), 'devil's advocate', broad interests.

education.degree_name: Gymnasium B (Nederlands, Engels, Latijn, Frans, Wiskunde B, Natuurkunde, Scheikunde, Economie I)

projects.title: IT Consultant/Web Developer at Nederlandse Montessori Vereniging + Nederlandse Dalton Vereniging, The Hague
projects.description:
As consultant/web developer responsible for the migration to/development of 2 new custom-built web based CRM systems in which all relations of the Nederlandse Montessori Vereniging and the Nederlandse Dalton Vereniging are managed. Incl. membership fee billing, licensing, inspections, subscriptions, exporting of invoices to Word and CASH.

Tasks:
- Database design
- Software development (ASP.NET, C#, XML, SQL Server)
- Data migration
- Training and support

projects.title: IT Consultant/Software Developer at VBS "Vereniging Verenigde Bijzondere Scholen"​, The Hague
projects.description:
Responsible for the development and management of custom-made CRM and MIS systems within VBS. Components of these systems include: relation management, time registration, billing hours/fees/subscriptions, management reports, data exchange with external systems (CASH, mijnvictor.nl).

The system was originally developed as MS Access front end to a SQL Server database. Later parts are web based (ASP/ASP.NET, C#).

Tasks:
- Consultancy
- Database design
- Software development (ASP, ASP.NET, C#, CSS, JavaScript, XML, MS Access, SQL Server)
- Training and Support

projects.description: Advised this ophtomological centre on setting up an intranet and the implementation of an intranet application for the registration of patient details.

projects.title: Technical Application Manager at Tiscali Benelux, Maarssen
projects.description:
Responsible for the daily management of the B2B contracts management and provisioning system. This system was used by 50 employees to manage and invoice B2B contracts and technically create products like web hosting and mailboxes.

Tasks:
- Application management
- Administrative and technical migrations from legacy systems to the new Tiscali B2B platform
- Generate management reports

projects.title: IT Consultant/Software Developer at N.V. PWN Waterleidingbedrijf Noord-Holland, Wormerveer/Bloemendaal
projects.description:
As a consultant/software developer employed in the product group Klantenservice en Distributie [Customer Service and Distribution] of one of the largest water companies in The Netherlands. The assignment consisted of redesigning an Access application and converting it to SQL Server. The application was used by more than 200 employees for the registration of almost all data relevant to the business processes in the product group.

Tasks:
- Redesign data model
- Redesign Access application
- Conversion from Access to SQL Server
- Supporting the maintenance department 
- Consultancy

projects.title: Member Research Team at Rabobank Nederland, Informatisering Betalingsverkeer, Beleid & Architectuur, Utrecht
projects.description:
In a small team (6 persons) we researched and rated new developments in the Internet area at usefulness for Rabobank and developed prototypes of new products for electronic banking.

The main prototype we developed evolved into the Rabobank product 'Minitix' for micro-payments via internet.

Tasks: 
- Functional design
- Functional description for the Rabobank management team
- Programming prototype internet micro-payment system (C/C++, ASP, JavaScript, SQL Server)

profile_positions.description:
The Crafts Company connects unemployed young adults with experienced older crafts people, ranging from plumbers to goldsmiths and from carpenters to tailors.
They work together in a master-apprentice setting for 12 months.

The craftspeople bring in their experience and skills and act as a mentor, both on technical and life skills.
While the young adults bring in their energy and knowledge of modern tools and techniques (like online promotion) and they offer a fresh view on old routines.
Thus creating a two-way learning experience.

The Crafts Company offers services to establish a long-term relationship between the young adult in need of a job with certainty and good future prospects and the craftsperson in need of an employee in this scarce labor market.

Interested in becoming an apprentice, master or partner? www.craftscompany.nl
profile_positions.title: Founder

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Amsterdam Quad Rugby Tournament (www.aqrt.nl) is the second largest international wheelchair rugby tournament in the world. The first edition took place in 2004, and since 2007 every other year. Wheelchair rugby is a Paralympic sport which is played by people with functional impairments to both their legs and arms, often due to a spinal cord injury.

About 300 people (athletes, coaches, volunteers) participate at the tournament, of whom 150 wheelchair-bound, demanding very specific requirements, e.g. on transportation and accommodation.

Tasks:
- Registration of participants
- Accommodation
- Invoicing
- Development of tournament software (ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, SQL Server)
- Sponsoring

Founder of a "Plusklas" for 9/10-year-old cognitively gifted children who needed more challenge than regular education could offer them.

The structure of the lessons was based on the method of the Day a Week School in Amsterdam.

Along with a varying group of parents I offered 12 children half a day a week extra challenge, focussing on contact with peers, collaborating, critical / analytical / creative thinking.
